messages.title: Peter FORTUNE: My priorities for Lewisham East
messages.content: I want to be your MP because I believe that the Labour Party finally deserves a fair deal. For too long the Labour Party has taken the people of Lewisham for granted. It's time that we had a new voice with new and clear priorities. It's time to make things better.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Ensuring fair allocation of local authority and housing association homes to make sure those most in need get them first
Ensure the return of the A&E and maternity services to Lewisham hospital
Support for local businesses, encouraging job creation, and revitalizing the local High Street
Enhancing the cleanliness and safety of local areas, including parks and streets
Focused on reducing crime and anti-social behavior

mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: Labour plan to borrow risks Â£170bn extra debt, and Coalition of Chaos

issues.economy: Protecting the recovering economy: Supporting local businesses, creating more jobs and revitalising the High Street.
issues.environment: Clean and pleasant environment: Working hard to make sure that the streets, parks and open spaces are cleaner and safer.
issues.health: A healthy community: Working to ensure the return of Accident & Emergency and maternity services to Lewisham Hospital.

housing.content: Housing for local people: Making sure those most in need get homes first.

leaflet.personalStatement: I want to be your MP because I believe that the Labour Party finally deserves a fair deal.

images.caption: Peter FORTUNE meeting with the public and engaging in community work.
